title: Is there wisdom inaccessible to the intellect? - Quora

response.answer_text: Only if you refuse to read it. It's called the Holy Bible. I have found different definitions to the same Biblical Hebrew and Greek words that the translators used to make the King James Translation. These definitions tell a modern day story of the creation that fits with what we see with our space telescopes in our own generation. It's not a word here and a word there like some people try to INTERPRETATE the scriptures. This is major word by major word sentence after sentence that's logical. ThirdEdit10-27-18Edit http://www.infinitestructure.com/

I believe there is. I think of the intellect’s attempts to access wisdom as being like a fork trying to measure water. It can capture a little bit, the bit that relates to the intellect (life experience, logic etc) but most of it slips straight through.
